content.text: For the choirmaster. With stringed instruments. A Maskil
of David. When the Ziphites went to Saul and said, “Is David not hiding among us?”
Save me, O God, by Your name,
and vindicate me by Your might!
listen to the words of my mouth.
For strangers rise up against me,
and ruthless men seek my life—
men with no regard for God. Selah
the Lord is the sustainer of my soul.
He will reward my enemies with evil.
Freely I will sacrifice to You;
I will praise Your name, O LORD, for it is good.
For He has delivered me from every trouble,
and my eyes have stared down my foes.

footnotes.text: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.
